poem:
**A Morning Muse on Headlines**

The ink still drying on a kingdom's page,  
futures trading in the nooks of power,  
where tycoons, cryptos, and golden towers  
converse across an ocean's long gaze.  
The pen mulls over fortune's sprawling shade,  
to list the gains in red and leaves in gold.  
The day begins, ideas unfurl,  
a poet's pen on fire.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Will the return of King Maga to the White House mean a Trumpification of British politics | Andrew Rawnsley We can list those people who expect to profit from the second coming of Donald Trump. They include the billionaire tech tycoons who were on conspicuous display at his inauguration, the oil companies who will be liberated to “drill, baby drill”, crypto-pushers and, um, Sir Ed Davey. I don’t know whether you’ve clocked it, and I’m". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
